tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my bronchitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro: In most cases, a Maple doctor can diagnose bronchitis online by asking about your symptoms and conditions. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they will be able to diagnose, prescribe appropriate medication, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest you go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or we’ll deliver it right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro:
Bronchitis occurs when your bronchial tubes (which carry air in and out of your lungs) become inflamed.

There are two types of bronchitis. Acute bronchitis is typically caused by viruses similar to the cold or flu, and usually passes in a week to 10 days. Chronic bronchitis is commonly caused by cigarette smoking, air pollution, dust, or toxic gases. Chronic bronchitis can last for months at a time, or longer.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of bronchitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms of bronchitis include:

  • Coughing
  • Fatigue
  • Fever and chills
  • Shortness of breath
  • Thick mucus from coughing
  • Chest discomfort

Acute bronchitis often goes away on its own without treatment. Chronic bronchitis might require medication for treatment. Your doctor may prescribe cough medicine, inhalers, or other oral medications than can help reduce inflammation.

With Maple, you can start consulting with a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
